text: We hear the faint sounds of a crowd cheering on Kobe Brya The real Bob Costas does narration.
Before the NBA was the NBA, there was another basketball league in America... DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE: This is real ABA footage. A series o great plays are made by ABA stars.

.From 1967 to 1976, there was the American Basketball Association. A maverick minor-league that would change the game forever. The ABA made the fast break FAST... Invented the three point shot... And introduced the world to something called the Slam Dunk Contest. DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE: Dr. J launches from the foul line an dunks in the world's first dunk contest. David Thompson finishes an Alley Oop.

Singer Pat Boone owned the Oakland Oaks. Wilt Chambelain coached the Conquistadors. I myself was the young voice of the St. Louis Spirits. DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE: A young Bob Costas broadcasts from S Louis, looking pretty sweet in side burns and a tweed jac

Players like Dr. J, Ice-man George Gervin and Moses Malone were as entertaining as they come. But despite the league's flair, convincing fans to show up for games was often a struggle. DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE: The infamous TV interview where Fred Lewis wins a 'race horse.' Footage of 'Dime Beer Night.' Footage of the Kentucky Colonials fielding a cheerleader one of their starting five. 2.
For owners, promotional ideas became an art form all to themselves. DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE: The Miami Ball Girls dance in bikini (In truth, some of the girls were still in high school).

One night, the Nets went as far as to give a free gerbil to it's first fifty fans... There were plenty of punches too, giving the National Hockey League a run for it's money. DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE: A guy elbows Connie Hawkins, who tur and punches the guy in the face.
Yes, the ABA had a style all it's own. The hair was big, the shorts were short and the ball was red, white and blue. DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE: Harry 'The fat Mexican guy' dances.
In 1976, rumors of a merger spread throughout the league. In the end, only four teams would join the NBA and survive. QUICK CUTS: THE PACERS. THE NUGGETS. THE NETS. THE SPURS.
Teams like the Kentucky Colonels and the Virginia Squires would disappear forever. But their spirit still lives on to this day.
We hear a crowd going crazy.
Here, we present the legend of the ABA... Exactly as it happened. Some FUNKY MUSIC plays.
Except, this Flint Michigan team never existed. 3. (BEAT)
And, well, everything in this movie is completely fake.
CLOSE ON: A logo of a basketball with a sombrero on it.

Welcome to the American Basketball Association. A fan chu his beer and throws some guacamole. The crowd screams and curses at MONIX, mid 40'S -- talent but past his prime. (There are three leading characters i this movie. This is the old rock. Think Nolte in 48 hours Cosner in Durham. Newman in Slap Shot).

The Amigos are up by one here. They'll need to find a way to stop Monix. He checks the clock, waits... And now drives the lane... MONIX suddenly takes a HUGE HIT, TOTALLY SLAMMED by a big asshole, PETRELLI. He flies into the crowd -- everyone erupts, screaming with glee.
Ooh, Monix gets taken out hard. Some tough love from Patrelli.
WHAT!? Where's the foul on that? That was all ball. (covering mic, screaming) Jesus Christ Leonard! Let them play for once! This ain't fuckin' Greenpeace!
Some might say that was a close call, but these referees have done a nice job tonight.
'Oh please. These refs SUCK. Still stuck in the crowd. Monix struggles to get back on court. The crowd shoves him around, twisting his ankle, slapping him. The crowd is nuts. 4.
Hey Monix, want a sip? Monix is confused, until the woman throws the beer in his face.
(smart ass) Oops. She and her friends laugh. Monix says nothing. Instead, h holds his aching back and limps up to the foul line, anno
(SMILING)
Sorry, Monix, I got pushed.

Well, it looks like the Amigos are in trouble here. Monix is a ninety percent shooter, if he can hit both of these free throws, it's over. Monix performs his ancient free throw ritual: Three dribb and a quick spin of the ball. But he MISSES.
Again, Monix ignores the drunk lady.
They dodged a bullet there. But Monix still has one last chance to tie it up. Monix focuses on his ritual again.
Monix aims at the basket, about to shoot, but then sudden WHIPS THE BALL HARD AT THE LADY, PEGGING HER IN THE FACE.
(re: nailing the girl) And the second free throw sails wide. 5.

Yes! He just pegged a chick! That's the greatest thing I've ever seen. The lady runs on court and attacks Monix, her boyfriend j in -- Monix hits her boyfriend with some quick hockey punches. The benches clear, everyone is punching everybod
(re: violent fist fight) And we've got a little bit of pushing and shoving under the basket. What do you make of this, Lou?
I'm goin' in. Lou Redwood takes his headphones off, climbs over the announcer's table and jumps into the fight.
Alright then. (BEAT)
More on this Amigo victory, right after this message from Colt 45.
Monix is beat up pretty bad. He dabs his cut with toilet paper.
Want one? SCHNACK, the owner, carries a six pack of Schlitz.
I'll take two. Schnack hands them over. Monix might speak, but he drinks instead.
So, Monix. The trade went through.
Really? (BEAT)
For who? 6.
You know, you're not exactly a spring chicken anymore...
Just tell me.
That score board. ANGLE ON: Pieces of an old scoreboard are crammed into th back of the locker room.
It's a Magnovox. (BEAT)
Tell me: What the Hell did you want to get traded back to Flint for, of all places? Please tell me this isn't about Lynn.
You still owe me $400.
A wide shot of the Flint Michigan skyline.
Super-cool CLARENCE WITHERS, 20's African-American, walks around a pet store. This guy is all flash. He spins a bal his finger, but he's more Bootsy Collins than Dr. J.

(on TV) Don't get all lonely on me people, get yourself a dog or a cat or some- - (studies a weird animal) Or a couple of these, from PET GALAXY. When I'm not dribbling between my legs or sinking jump shots, I'm buying animals. And if this isn't thebeststore in Flint Michigan (re:hisafro) I will shave this off.Nojoke. Make a fast break overtoPET GALAXY. And be sure to tell'emSugar Dunkerton sent you. 7. With that, Clarence chest-passes the ball out of frame an smiles.
WE PULL BACK to see the TV is on inside a restaurant, Quincy's BBQ. REVEAL: Clarence. The guy from the TV is also a waiter in this restaurant. He's taking an order from some customers
Hey, wasn't that you just now, there on the TV?
Yeah, so?
What are you waiting on us for, if you're a basketball star?
Who the Hell areyou,the barbecue police? Tell youwhat,I've got the note pad, so I'llaskthe questions: Do youwanta baked potato with that?
The TV said your name was Sugar Dunkerton. How come your name-tag doesn't say that?
'Cause I changed my name, that's why.
(reading his name tag) Downtown Funky-Stuff Malone?
You like it?
I guess it's fine.
It ain't fine. (as in smooth) It's fine... 8 A large woman, QUINCY -- Clarence's Mom -- yells from the kitchen.

THEN I CAN'T HEAR A GOD DAMN THING.
GET YOUR ASS OUT OF HERE.

text: Shit. (to the customers) It's been a pleasure serving you. Clarence tosses his note pad on the table and his Mother tosses him his duffle bag.
And don't think I didn't see those cotton briefs of yours in there.
Stay outta my stuff!
Don't you know our ancestors had to pick that cotton? Get yourself some silk underpants. Have some respect.
Panties are silk. Briefs are cotton. I'm out of here.
Ladies and gentleman, please rise...
Welcome to Flint Michigan Fairgrounds Coliseum, basketbal end of the world. This is more like a shitty airplane han than a stadium. 9.
.For the National Anthem... Of your Flint Michigan Tropics.
PICTURE 1: The one-hit-wonder, Jackie moon is on an album cover, shirtless, petting a white leopard.

Baby, who wants to; love me sexy. baby, are you ready to; lick me sexy. PICTURE 2: Jackie Moon in Reno, singing with Pat Boone. H holds up his only hit single. PICTURE 3: Jackie is getting married to LUCY MOON. She's hottest girl in the world.

Center court, we finally see JACKIE MOON. He sports a per lamb chop sideburns and black frame glasses. He continues sing this song of his own creation...
(SINGING)
Oh yeah, Baby, who wants to; love me sexy. baby, are you ready to; lick me sexy. Jackie Moon is a sight to see. His one-hit-wonder is ridiculous. But you have to admit it's catchy.
THE CROWD: Under 100 people are in the stands, but they'r high energy. Lots of drinking and dancing. 10.

Take off your shoes and; suck me sexy. THE BALL GIRLS: They bounce around in shiny-funky hot pan dancing cool, but not in sync. When it comes to ball girl Flint delivers. THE TROPICAL AISLE: A rowdy bunch is decked out in Hawaii shirts and packed in behind the visiter's bench, looking trouble. THE SCOREBOARD: The Magnovox has been sold. The Tropics n do it by hand.
Baby, we're naked and we're; humping sexy... ANGLE ON DARREN AND JODY: Two kids in WHEEL CHAIRS are pa next to the hardwood, eating nachos and drinking giant co
(to kids in wheel chairs) Hey there son, what's your name?
Fuck you, Mitchstien.
Yeah. Throw any elbows tonight and we'll pound your fuckin' head into the floor. MUSIC CUE: 'TOO HOT TO HANDLE' BY HEATWAVE. With that, the lights go out, PITCH BLACK. A spot light d on Jackie Moon.

At ball girl, measuring thirty four, twenty two, thirty six, MELIN- DAAAAAAA. MELINDA shakes her perfect measurements in the spotlight, then does a series of cartwheels.

I'm living a dream, Flint and I know you are too. (Booming voice again) AT GUARD, from Peoria Illinois, six foot one -- this guy's single and he can cook lasagna, I've seen him do it -- TWIGGY -- MUNSONNNNNNN! Bobby Dee hits the disco ball as TWIGGY trots out.
FROM SOUTH BEND INDIANA, the man with a heart of gold, his brother's a retard, six foot one, he drives down to visit all the time, at forward, he reads to him, BEE BEE

YOUR MAN IN THE MIDDLE. Seven foot two, from the People's Republic of Uzbechistan, he's tall, he's sensitive -- loves candle light and long walks on the beach -- VAKIDIS
(Vakidis remains seated) Vakidis, that's you man, I called your name. (no response) VAKIDIS! C'mon dude, let's go, get it together. Players push the giant Vakidis out onto the court.

Now this next guy, where do I start? First of all, that wife of his, she is... Wow. (gesturing re: her chest) CANONS, people. If you know what I'm saying. I don't think she's here tonight, but if she was you'd see what I'm talking about. 12. He's a small forward, the luckiest man in Flint: SCOOTSIE DOUBLE-
Scootsie Double Day 'pops n' locks' his way onto the cour

AND FINALLY: The man you've been waiting for, six foot four, a solid, meaty, two hundred fifteen pounds, your pre-game announcer, your owner, your coach, your pop singing sensation, but most importantly, your POWER FORWARD... Yours truly... JACKIE M00000000N!!! Jackie takes off his blazer, twirls it, then tosses it of screen. It's game time. At center court, PLAYER/OWNER/COACH JACKIE huddles them u
Alright you guys, let's huddle up! (Vakidis is wandering) Vakidis! Where's he walking to? Kong, get Vakidis. A very short Asian man, KONG, nods. The uniform hangs on tiny body.
You got it boss.

(now huddled up) Let's put on a good show tonight, okay? Let's keep it in the air, keep shooting, look for the baseball pass, launch some early threes to set the tone. Bee Bee, try and do that no-look behind your back thing, I love that, okay? Now let's bring it in. One two three--
(TOGETHER)
REVEAL: An orange cone sits over a puddle on the court. As the Tropics break the huddle, Jackie talks to the overweight FATHER PAT THE REF. 13.
(smart ass) Hey, you lose weight, Father Pat?
Oh, fuck off. What's with the cone tonight Jackie? Jackie points up to a leak in the ceiling.
For safety. Just then, Vakidis jogs over, SLIPPING HORRIBLY in the puddle, ripping his groin.
(as P.A. Announcer) Okay Tropics fans, it's time to guess today's attendance... Is it A) 9,254. B) 10,506.. or C) 91 TIP OFF: The Tropics gain possession.
Scootsie drops it in low to player- owner-coach Jackie Moon. Known best for his aggressive defense, leads the team in rebounds. He's an animal under the boards Lou.
You're Damn right. He may not be black, but he can play basketball.
Now, look at this, Jackie waves the rest of his team away, looking for the isolation. These fans are in for a real treat.
He looks to be setting up his 'Tear Drop from Hades.'
Jackie is shooting thirty-nine percent from the field, but the crowd always loves to see him go for it.
He's a true showman. 14. Jackie dribbles hard to the hoop, tossing up a high arcin baby hook. AIRBALL.
Airball.
Yep, a Polish swish.

Scootsie Double-Day gets the offensive rebound and Jackie calls for it again, trying to establish the low post early. Jackie holds the ball, preparing for another 'Tear Drop f Hades'... But now he suddenly gets distracted by somethin in the stands.
(into the stands)
IN THE STANDS: A Pakistani vendor, RAVI, IS POURING CHEES SOME NACHOS.
What?

Enough with the cheese already. More chips, less cheese, how many times do I have to tell you? WHISTLE! Jackie's been walking with the ball. FATHER PAT REF wears a holy collar with pin strips over it.
Traveling.
Traveling!?... On who?
On you.
That's bullshit, Father Pat! Jackie, furious, SLAMS THE BALL down on the floor. 15.
Jackie Moon. The most passionate man in sports.
Some hot girls in shorts hold up a sign that says 'ALL ST PARKING.' Ms. Quincy's BBQ delivery truck rips into the l Clarence skids to a stop.
The crowd looks off camera and suddenly erupts. CLARENCE enters out of the tunnel, he takes a bite of a Hershey bar, then gestures to the crowd, giving the international symbol for 'Let's get funky.'

Ladies and gentleman, put your hands together for Downtown Funky- Stuff Malone! Clarence tosses the half eaten candy bar, wipes his hands on his jersey and jogs right out onto the court during th game, TAGGING HIS TEAMMATE OUT as if it were pick up.
Downtown, wastes no time entering the game -- tagging out Vakidis Roscovenski.
(to the ref) C'mon Father Pat, he's got to check into the game doesn't he? The ref just shrugs. Downtown calls for the ball and gets

Downtown dribbles left, then right a little shake and bake through the legs -- double teamed now, he's got Twiggy Munson open under the basket. Downtown, still with the ball, dribbles behind his back, they triple him, he's got Munson and Ellis wide open under the hoop, but look at these moves! The entire other team leaves their men and guards Clarenc five on one, but Clarence never passes. His four teammate watch from under the basket. 16. Despite his selfish attitude, it's clear Clarence actuall has some serious talent.
Downtown has all five guys on him -- He sprints to the corner and forces up a fade away three... YES! Wow. You think this league's going bankrupt? Well, think again.
People call him selfish. I call him the greatest show in shorts.

CLOSE ON: An old-timey photo of a man with a handle-bar moustache. It's been autographed by the inventor of basketball: 'Go Tropics! -James Naismith' The team enters the locker room happy, even though they'r losing badly at half time.
Yes! Nice first half guys! That's what I call Flint Tropic's basketball! (BEAT)

I've been telling you all season, we're about to make a run. Flint Michigan is destined for greatness. (at the chalkboard) Twiggy, enough with the bounce passes, let's show some zip. Bee Bee, try not to get fouled so much, free throws take too long. Scootsie, what did I tell you about catching with two hands.? God gave you one hand for a reason: To look awesome. Jackie points to the chalkboard. Where one of his catchy slogans is spelled out.
Let's stay focused on the four

(pointing to the board) Dangerous, Dangerous, Dangerous, Dunks. Remember: This isn't just a basketball team. It's a lifestyle. 17. Everyone claps. Meanwhile, Clarence grabs a bunch of hair products and goes to work. But he notices something.
Yo, Jackie, is the washing machine broken? ANGLE ON: A few workers are taking out the washing machin

Listen up guys: I've got some good news and I've got some bad news. The good news is, we're getting rid of that piece of shit washing machine. The bad news is, everyone does their laundry at home from now on. Towels too. Everyone complains. Boo etc. Jackie turns to BOBBY DEE a 'front office' guy.
And Bobby Dee, I need you to clean out your desk.
No. I have kids.
You're not fired. I sold your desk.
Oh.
(to the team) And I'm going to shed a few lockers, so everyone's getting a locker buddy.
Forget that. I need my own locker... For the panty dropper. Clarence reveals his 'panty dropper' a brown full-length leather coat.
Fine. Now, there's one last thing: I've added some depth to the roster. I think he could deliver some firepower. 18.
Firepower? Who'd you hire?
At guard, six one, the hometown kid, from your very own Flint Michigan -- He punches in bunches Ed MONIXXXXXXXX! We hear a TOILET FLUSH. Monix exits the bathroom stall buttoning his pants.
You're out of toilet paper. Monix doesn't receive a warm welcome. It's more of a star off.

Okay, now, I know everyone in this room has probably been punched in the face by Monix at one time or another. (Scootsie fumes) One of you may have even had your collar bone broken, twice. But that's in the past now and-
Yo, Jackie, you're on in two.
Thanks Bobby. (almost to himself) I love half time. (abruptly to Monix) Anyways, welcome aboard. (LEAVING)
One last thing: If you see a possum try and kill it. With that, Jackie leaves. Monix faces his team in silence
So. Who wants to be my locker buddy?

It's half time show. Jackie has pulled a lucky contestant from the audience. 19. DUKES, the contestant, is shirtless with jeans, with a st spangled bandana over a mullet. He plays with a ball a little. A giant five by ten check is propped up, with the words ' THOUSAND DOLLARS' written in glitter.
Ladies and Gentleman, this man is about to attempt the impossible. The $10,000 full court shot. So, tell me, what's your name?
Dukes.
Okay, Dukes. You feeling it?
Yeah dude.
What are you going to spend all of your money on if you win? A shirt?
Yeah man, a shirt. Ha! Whoooo!

Okay people, Dukes is excited. Let's get some clapping going as he prepares himself for the impossible. (leading the clapping) This is drama, folks! C'mon now, let's hear it! The $10,000 shot people, let's hear it!!! For the first time, Dukes looks kind of serious. He sizes the distant hoop...
(doing play by play) He looks ready... And... Here he goes! An uncoordinated baseball pass... Sailing off into the distance... And...
The crowd can't believe their eyes. 20. JACKIE'S FACE TURNS GHOST WHITE.
Shit.
Jackie is freaking out. Dukes has just won $10,000! Dukes runs around court, shirtless, leaping in celebration.
(to Father Pat the Ref) Did he step on the line?
No, it was legal. He made it.
Who the Hell has $10,000? I sure he stepped on the line, you know what I'm saying?
(getting the hint) Listen to this crowd. You can't screw a kid over like that. People will kill you. He's right. The crowd is too hyped for Jackie to explain he's broke.
(accepting his fate) Fuck me.

text: A beautiful, down to earth woman, LYNN, 30's, is reading book. In the background, her boyfriend, KYLE, is listenin the Tropics game on the RADIO.

Monix was an All-American at Michigan State, but then went on to a disappointing journeyman career in the NBA. But he did manage to sit on the bench with the world champion Boston Celtics years ago and won a ring.
(on radio) I should hire his agent. Kyle listens to this and yells to the other room.
Hey honey, guess who got traded to Flint?
I don't know, who?
Monix. The word Monix stops her in her tracks.
Monix?
Yeah! He's already got an NBA ring, but he's still playing... In Flint. Can you believe it?
No, I can't. Lynn closes her book, fidgety...
They say he asked to be traded. Who the Hell leaves California to come here? I love this guy.
Jackie cruises the streets of Flint in a pimped out Monte Carlo. He's got chrome rims and a gold grill. The interio wall to wall carpeting. He swigs a beer as he turns.
(singing with car stereo) Get the funk outta-of-my-face... A SIGN SAYS: THE KREMLIN. Jackie rolls up and parks in a reserved parking space. He rolls up the windows and locks doors by hand and exits.
Patrick Ewing style, right over his slacks. A police officer drinks, in uniform, outside.
What's up Jackie?
Not much.
(re: the big ice packs) Your knees okay?
Oh yeah. Just icing them down.
'The Kremlin' is rocking. The beer is served in cans only
Hey Jackie!
Well look at you! You look beautiful. What's different?
I dyed my hair.
No, that's not it... Did your tits get bigger?
Don't lie to me. Those things got bigger.
No, they're the same.
Well, good job. Jackie keeps walking, bumping into MS. QUINCY, Clarence's mother.

Yo Jackie. You know, that wife of yours has been making out with that Mark Spitz lookin' motherfucker all night. She gestures to a guy who's lip-locked with Jackie's wife LUCY MOON unbuttons her fur coat.
Oh. It's okay, Lucy and I've got an open relationship.
I know that. But he's about to suck on her Damn tits, right here in front of all these people.
She's hot right? What can I say, we're freedom lovers. (calling off to his wife) Hey honey! Lucy Moon ignores him, only making out harder.
(to his wife) Right on! (to Quincy) I'm not jealous. It's a sweet deal for both of us.
Have you ever slept with another woman?
I could. That's the beauty of it. No ball and chain here. 24. I can just go for it. You know, if I ever get invited to some cool orgy, it's definitely not a problem at all.
Have you ever been to an orgy?
Pshh. Are you kidding? When haven't I been?
MONIX is hanging out with Bee Bee Ellis, Scootsie Double and Twiggy Munson. They all do a shot together.
I heard Jackie is going to go to some owner's meeting. What do you think that's about?
I don't know, but it can't be good.
Hey, let's see that championship ring, Monix.
Yeah, you promised we could see the ice. Monix takes the ring out. It hangs from his neck.
Look at this piece. It says Celtics right there in diamonds.
Why don't you wear it on your finger?
I don't know, I just like to wear it around my neck, that's all. NOW CLARENCE chimes in without looking over...
Not everyone sits around dreaming of playing in the NBA, you know. 25.
Maybe not. But you do.
Yeah, that's all you ever talk about.
You're not jealous, are you Clarence?
No one calls me Clarence.
His name's Downtown.
Okay Downtown. I'll make sure Downtown is only referred to as Downtown, okay Downtown?
Don't think I don't know what you're doing. You're doing that thing where you pretend to mean what you say, but you don't.
Sarcasm.
Yeah. How'd you like that sarcasm smacked off your face?
Bring it, funky stuff.
That's sarcasm, man. He's doing it again!
(to Bee Bee) I got this, alright? Monix squares off with a smile that says 'hit me.' Claren takes off his leather full length and folds it nicely.
(in Monix's face) How'd you like a knuckle sandwich? 26.
Knuckle sandwich? Who says that?
I do motherfucker. I'm gonna pound you so hard, you're-- MONIX REARS HIS FIST BACK, about to release a strong Pope

(into the mic) The year was 1973. A young musician named Jackie Moon, finishes years of musical training, only to find he is a slave to the notes on the page. He knows it's time to break free. In a sudden fit of creative mastery, he grabs a pen and a napkin and writes a song that breaks all the rules. Ladies and gentleman... Let's get sweaty. MUSIC CUE: Jackie's song. Everyone goes crazy.
(studio version) Baby, who wants to; love me sexy. baby, are you ready to; lick me sexy. Take off your shoes and; suck me sexy. Baby, we're naked and we're; humping sexy--
Gayle and Monix walk upstairs into the 'coolest' room eve Carpet on the ceiling, a plaid couch, a fish tank, a wate bed, mirrors, etc.
I'm glad they traded for you, I got myself a cute one.
So, this is the Daiquiri room? 28.
That's right. REVEAL: LUCY MOON, Jackie's wife, is on the couch. She's hottest girl in the world.
What do you think, Gayle? Does he like it with my boots on, or does he like my boots off?
He seems like a boots on kind of guy.
Then it looks like I'm ready. As soon as you slide these shorts off of me.
Aren't you Jackie's wife?
He knows about the Daiquiri room.
It's a new tradition we're starting, when new players join.
I see. Well, I'm going to have to pass. I'm good, thanks.
Honey, you don't know what good is. With that, Lucy flicks on the stereo--
Listen um... (i.e. what's your name?)
My name is 'no strings attached.'
You can call me Mrs. Moon. Gayle and Lucy perform a funky/seductive dance, moving cl and closer to Monix. 29.
I don't think this is going to happen, Mrs. Moon.
It has to.
It's bad luck if you don't.
Yeah, I'd hate to bring bad luck to Flint Michigan. Lucy has sprayed some WHIP CREAM on her nipples.
(whip cream) Why don't you lick these clean for me?
I can't eat dairy. Lucy decides that now is a good time to aggressively KISS him. Monix pushes her away.
Nice tits, Mrs. Moon. I gotta go. Monix walks down the stairs.
(calling after him) I see what this is: You want us to send Eric and Marcus up here? On the way out, Monix flicks her off.
Lynn is asleep next to Kyle. She awakes to someone poundi on the door.
Lynn has arrived at the screen door. Monix, wasted, doesn notice Lynn yet, he keeps pounding until she opens it.
Why are you here? 30.
I got traded.
I mean, why are you here?
Can we talk?
--Yo, Monix, you're wasted! Ha! Kyle has come out to say hi.
Yeah. Sorry man--
What's up! That of jump shot of yours ain't broke yet, is it?
No. Ha.
Great back door cut for the lay-up in the third. That's how basketball should be played.
Kyle, can you give us a second? We need to talk.
No problem. Great game tonight man.
Why does your boyfriend like me so much?
You're his favorite player.
Look, there are still some things I think we need to talk about.
I've already said everything I'm ever going to say to you. 31.
I see. (BEAT)
Well, I guess I'll be leaving then. Monix walks away... Then turns back.
You're really not going to stop me?
No. Monix walks more, until Lynn speaks.
You're going to end up walking with a cane the rest of your life. You have to quit.
And do what?
I don't know... Kill yourself, I guess.
Kill myself?
You act like there's nothing else in the world besides basketball. If that's how you really feel, then go ahead and get it over with. I'm going to sleep.
Thanks for the pep. talk.
No problem.
Lynn. (she opens the door again) Can I ask you for one favor?
You want a favor?
My knee. 32.
Oh, Jesus Christ Monix. It's 4 a.m. Lynn stares at him in disbelief. Monix shrugs.
No one here can drain it right.
Fine. Monix nods, then makes a move toward the door.
No. You're not coming in. We'll do it in the yard.
Jackie drives in his car, practicing for the meeting. tri to build some confidence.
(into the rear view, very

Well, hello Commissioner -- Why sure, I would love one of your Puerto Rican cigars -- Oh, I know I'm a legitimate owner, you don't have to tell me that -- We're merging with the NBA? Oh, that's nice -- Ha Ha Ha! Good one, Commish ...
A brick building on the outskirts of Indianapolis. A sign says. WELCOME ABA OWNERS. Jackie pulls into the lot and parks. He looks in the mirror one last time.
Your Mom would be proud of you today.
Not-quite-Rich guys surround a large oak table. JACKIE is far the youngest of the owners. 33.
.I'm sure each of you have heard the rumors. And I'm here to tell you, the rumors are true. The ABA will be merging with the NBA at the end of this season.
(to an old guy)
(fists to the ceiling)
Our league is sold. And the NBA agreed to all of our financial demands! Now Jackie turns inward, more quietly intense. This is, without question, the greatest moment of his life.
(to himself) You're a real owner. You're in the NBA.
Four of our teams will be absorbed into the NBA family, the rest of you will terminate operations.
Exactly! You know it! (now hearing) I'm sorry, wait, what?
The Nuggets, The Nets, The Spurs and the Pacers will play in the NBA next year. The rest of us will dissolve.
Dissolve? Dissolve, like, how? How do I dissolve into the NBA? The winning owners look at each other, not sure how to ha Jackie.
What's happening? 34.
I'm sorry Jackie. We all know how. emotional you get. We waited until the very last second to tell you. Jackie pounds the table.
No. NO! NO!!! He kicks over his chair...
We know you're upset, Jackie. But you'll be very well compensated.
Everyone's agreed to a very large sum.
I don't want a sum! I want my team! (to the losing owners) C'mon you guys, you're not going to just sit here and take the money, are you? They are.
(to winning owners) What do the Spurs have that we don't?
A huge fan base. A brand new stadium. A solid economic growth package, including strong tax incentives.
Oh, c'mon, that's BULLSHIT!
The NBA is taking four teams, Jackie, there's nothing I can do. Jackie goes quiet, thinking... An epic idea hits him.
The best four teams should go. 35.
What?
Forget the huge fan base, the stadiums, the economic... (a little lost) Growing... package... inventions...
(correcting him) Economic growth pack--
(to the room) The four teams with the best records should merge.
He's right.
Yeah, that's the fairest way.
These four teams DO have the best records. Flint's only won six games all year!
So far. The season isn't over.
Yeah, maybe we should finish the season first.
This plan sounds like a lot of fun, but it's too late. The commissioner, me, has already decided.
Actually, the terms of a merger can only be approved by a league mandate.
YES. That's right. What he said. 36.
I move that we vote on the terms of the merger.
The team sits around the parking lot, sitting on their du bags, dejected. Jackie is having a team meeting.
C'mon you guys, let's try to stay psyched. This is a chance to become a real NBA franchise!
There's no way we can make it to fourth place. It's mathematically impossible.
I ran the numbers. All we have to do is win about eighty-two percent of our remaining games.
Eighty-two percent? Isn't that a lot?

Oh, c'mon! We just gotta start hitting our threes. (guys look around, unsure) Listen, I know this seems like bad news, but it doesn't have to be. This is a big road trip for us. We've just got to start playing solid Flint basketball.
I don't know. We suck, man. JACKIE SLAPS SCOOTSIE.
(re: The slap) Sorry. JACKIE SLAPS HIM AGAIN, HARDER.
We do not suck, okay? We just have to want it! 37. Pumped, Jackie walks around with his hands on his hips.
What do you think, Monix? All eyes turn on the grumpy one.
I think we suck.
Well... See, now there's some team unity! Now let's load up the jet. REVEAL: A SHITTY SCHOOL BUS has the words 'THE JET!' Spra painted in graffiti letters with a palm tree next to it.
(as they load up) Now we've got a special treat. You know I take care of my family. Today, the Jet is catered. I had Downtown's Mom pack us some hot dish.
Ms. Quincy's hot dish? Sweet!
The guys load up. It's so packed it's ridiculous. Everyon tries to stuff their gear somewhere and sit down. Jackie carries a big pot of hot dish, accidentally burnin Scootsie's back.
Ah, watch the hot dish, man.
Sorry Scootsie.

Hey Jackie, there's some dude out there, wants to talk to you. POV: Out the window, we can see DUKES, the full court sho winner, holding his GIANT CHECK and looking into the bus. He's still shirtless, with a star-spangled headband.
Jackie and Dukes are next to the bus, discussing the chec 38.
I tried Jackie. They won't take it. They said it's 'symbolic.'
What does symbolic mean?
I don't know. But they said I need a real check.
I don't know what your bank is talking about. That is a real check. I signed it myself.
It's written in glitter, dude. Can't you just give me, like, a regular sized one?
I don't get it. People are usually able to cash these. Maybe you should try another bank. (trying to wrap it up) If you run into any more trouble, let me know.
Okay Jackie, thanks man.
Any time, congratulations. Jackie turns away from Dukes and exhales, walking back to bus. MUSIC CUE: 'SHORT PEOPLE' BY RANDY NEWMAN.
We're flying down the highway.
Kong, the small Asian player, is driving, singing along w Jackie to the radio...
(singing Randy Newman) SHORT PEOPLE GOT, NO REASON... 39. SHORT PEOPLE GOT, NO REASON...

head_text.subj: SHORT PEOPLE GOT, NO REASON TO LIVE

text: Jackie reaches up into a special bin and takes out some b jerky, then yells out the window.
(out the window at a car)

Pan back to see the whole team crammed into tiny seats. Vakidis has his knees pointing straight toward the ceilin Twiggy Munson is reading '70's pornography. Clarence is sewing a new name onto his jersey. The rest of the guys a eating their hot dish.
So, Clarence, what's in this 'hot dish' anyway?
My Mom cooked your ass a whole Damn meal, why you gotta go asking what's in it?
It's a compliment. It's good.
If it's good, then it's good. Why do you gotta know what's in it? What's in hot dish? Hot dish is in hot dish, asshole. BEE BEE and SCOOTSIE look over the seat, facing them.
Hey Monix, what were the Celtics like?
They were fast.
Fast? No one's faster than me. I should be on the Celtics.
(pointing to his mind) Fast up here. 40.
You're supposed to be Mr. Smartball. Why'd you get bounced?
Well, you have to be able to jump too.
Hey, let us see that ring again.
Not right now, okay Twiggy?
Isn't it a little embarrassing wearing that thing everyday?
Embarrassing?
You call yourself a Celtic? You sat through every single playoff game. You didn't see action once. And now you walk around wearing the ice like you're Bill Russel. Well you ain't.
Oh, you're just jealous.
Yeah, Monix played solid minutes, for lots of teams. He's played in the NBA, that's more than you can say.

Whatever. At least I never sat on the bench and then called myself a champion. You didn't do shit for that Celtic team. If I was Dave Cowens, I'd yank that ring right off your neck. That was a pretty heated exchange. Monix looks like he's something to say, but he doesn't. Clarence has the last w
He doesn't wear it on his finger because he knows he didn't earn it. He didn't even play. 41. Monix looks out the window.
'The Jet' is parked outside the arena.
We're just a few minutes away from game one of the Tropic's 6 game road trip. With talk of an NBA merger hitting the league, there's a new electricity surrounding tonight's game...
Jackie addresses his team before tip off.

Alright. Now, a lot of people out there are writing us off. A lot people are saying things like 'Jackie Moon is an offensive liability.' They're saying 'Flint's turnovers led to sixty fast break points per game.' (Making this up) They're saying 'Bee Bee's retarded brother is so retarded that his eyes look too big,. Like a French Bulldog.
No one said that, man.
(trying to motivate) Yes they did. And we're going to use it as motivation, okay? THIS IS
GAME 1) JACKIE MOON sprints across the floor tries to get f eet planted in the lane. It's not even close, JACKIE HA TAKEN A GUY DOWN HARD. The ref whistles a blocking foul. 42.
OH, C'MON!? Where's the charge, Father Pat?
Both feet weren't planted.

head_text.subj: OH, SUCK MY COCK. I WILL MURDER

text: That's it, you're out.

What!? What did I say? Jackie takes a ball and drop kicks it, PUNTING IT high up into the rafters. BUZZER! FINAL SCORE: COLONELS 111 TROPICS 92. GAME 2) MONIX drives the lane, fast and smart -- A no-loo pass hits Scootsie Double-Day in the shoulder.
GAME 3) CLARENCE and BEE BEE jog back on Defense.
I ain't guarding my guy anymore.
Why not?
He's too'Damn sweaty, man. (re: his wet uniform) Look at me.
Gross. Well, I ain't guarding him. Monix notices this discussion.

Quit talking and play defense! The sweaty guy backs in on Clarence, posting up top. 44. GAME 5) Jackie Moon plays great defense, rejecting a shot Monix grabs the ball and dribbles on a fast break. Claren trails, in perfect position...
Right on! I'm open baby! Try a behind-the-back! Monix delivers a nice two handed bounce pass, but Clarenc isn't ready for anything fundamentally sound -- The ball him in the nuts.
Ah, shit. BUZZER! FINAL SCORE: PIPERS 105 TROPICS 91.
Angle on a big hotel with fancy lights -- but then we pan reveal: A shitty motel. The 'Jet' is parked at the cheap place.

Two twin beds in a crap-box motel room. Monix has the pho to his ear, but it just keeps ringing. He'd leave a messa for Lynn, but answering machines haven't been invented ye He hangs up, looks in the mirror, and now takes his Championship ring necklace off. He looks at the ring in his hand... And shoves it into hi duffle bag.
I brought us some ice. Monix is startled. Clarence, his roommate for the night, enters.
Ice? What for?
I don't know, it's free. Clarence takes some ice, pops it in his mouth and starts crunching.
Want some? 45.
No thanks. Now BEE BEE enters, yet another player in the small room.

That Root Beer machine took my fucking change, man. White people are assholes. Monix ignores this. Laying back, he focuses on the TV: TH CELTICS are playing. Their trapping defense is a thing of beauty. Clarence walks over and flicks the channels, until he sto at 'Love American Style.'
You turned off the Celtics?
I don't watch people play basketball. They watch me. With that, Clarence pulls out a JOINT and lights it.
(re: the marijuana) What the Hell is that?

(as he inhales) It's a fucking Egg-McMuffin. Monix opens the window, clearing the pot smoke out of his face. JACKIE EXITS the bathroom, having just taken a shower. He wearing a very small robe. This is now the fourth player who's sleeping in this tiny room.
Why don't you shower in your room?
My wife is using it. I'll be crashing with you guys tonight. (NOTICING)
Ice? Awesome. (as he eats ice, re: TV) Love American Style? Turn it up. 46. Jackie doesn't say a word about the pot. Instead he keeps eyes glued to the TV, then reaches for the joint and SMOK IT.
Jackie, have you ever even slept with your wife?
(LYING)
What? Are you kidding? Try, like, every weekend. She's so hot.
Sounds like a great arrangement.
You guys need to wake up. Quit living like it's the 1950's, man. Live it up. (showing off) Hey Clarence, let's have some of that smoke, bro.
I'm pretty sure we have a game tomorrow.
(as he inhales) This stuff won't affect you. It's premium. Jackie finishes inhaling, then holds it out for Monix. He stares at the joint, then around the room at his teammate
Well, if this is really going to be my life, I might as well be stoned like everyone else.
Well said. Monix takes the stupid joint. The instant Monix inhales h COUGHS LIKE CRAZY.
What the Hell is this?
What do you mean? 47.
It's harsh.
Take that back.
Take what back?
His Mom grows it.
Yeah, in the yard.
Your Mom grew this?
It's sweet grass.
Well, I'm finished, thanks.
What's wrong, my Mom's weed ain't good enough for you?
I guess not.
C'mon man, have some respect for his Mom's weed.
That's it, I ain't sleeping in the same bed as this motherfucker.
Television cameras are being set up. A camera man cleans lens. Jackie studies the cameras, mesmerized by the idea of television. He speaks with the Amigo's manager.
You want all the fans to sit on one side of the stadium? 48.
Yeah, just move all those people over to this side. (DEMONSTRATING)
See, the TV cameras are going to face this way, right? Well, if we fill the seats on that side, we'll look sold out.
Actually, that's not a bad idea. MEANWHILE, ON THE COURT: Both teams are warming up. Clare now has a new name on his Jersey. There are so many words there is barely space for a number. It's a mess.
(re: Jersey, new name) Check it out. I sewed it on the bus.
(struggling to read it) What's it say?
Jumping Johnny Johnson. The asshole, PETRELLI, wanders over near the Tropics side the court.
Yo, Granny Yarn Barn, how's the needle point going?
Kiss my ass, Petrelli.
(re: the Jersey name) Hey man, I think you spelled 'Flint sucks balls' wrong. (BEAT)
This guy's the next Betsy Ross! Aren't you Clarence? The guys laugh. MONIX walks up, defending his teammate.
No one calls him Clarence. His name
(BEAT)
What's your name? 49.
Jumping Johnny Johnson.
His name's Jumping Johnny Johnson. (nose to nose) You got that? Jackie hurries over.
Alright, break it up. (to his team) Everyone huddle up!... VAKIDIS! OVER HERE. Where is he walking to? (BEAT)
Fuck it. Listen up, we're on National TV tonight. And you all know what that means: The league needs a good clean game.
Oh, that's a bunch of dog shit.

Hey! You guys want to merge or not? Because the fastest way to screw this up is to start punching people in the face while the commissioner is at home, watching the game with his kids... Children are very impressionable. Their minds are not yet soiled by the cruel realities of this world.
What?

No punching. Behind the huddle, FANS BEGIN WALKING RIGHT ACROSS THE CO Both teams turn to watch this strange thing. The Amigos manager leads the herd, Jackie helps out, directing them across to the other side.

head_text.subj: ACROSS- IF YOU COULD JUST FILL IN
ALL OF THOSE EMPTY SEATS IN THAT

text: The optical illusion has worked. The game does indeed loo crowded. The game is in full swing.

This sold out crowd is loving this one, the Amigos up by twenty-six here in the second. Monix drains a nice jumper, but out of nowhere, Petrelli, guy we hate, throws a hard shoulder, knocking Monix to th floor.
That's a moving pick Father Pat! C'mon!
Play on. Monix can't believe it. Petrelli taunts Monix.
What's wrong Monix, cat got your 'nads? Monix faces off.
(POINTING)
Not with the cameras. (miming the commish') He's watching. Monix looks around and thinks...
What about commercials?
What?
Commercials, what about commercials? Jackie thinks about this, then nods 'good idea.'
I like it. Time out Ref! 51.
A time out on the floor, 5:20 left before the half, the Amigos 45, the Tropics 19, we'll be right back after this message from Shasta. The camera's on air' red light turns off.
(rooting them on) And... You're clear.

head_text.subj: PETRELLI TAKES THE HIT AND TACKLES MONIX.
BOTH BENCHES CLEAR. THE CROWD GOES NUTS.

text: The commissioner relaxes at home with his two kids... A Shasta commercial is on TV.
(on TV) I want a pop... I want a -- Shasta...

head_text.subj: MAYHEM. JACKIE MOON IS YANKING A FAN'S HAIR.
A TALL GUY IS ABOUT TO POUND SHORT LITTLE KONG. BUT NOW K
JUMPS IN THE AIR AND DOES A SWEET ROUND-HOUSE JUDO KICK,
KNOCKING THE TALL GUY TO THE FLOOR.

text: Hi-Ya! MEANWHILE: MONIX AND PETRELLI ARE TRADING HOCKEY PUNCHES.
And we're back in -5- (Monix punches Petrelli) -4- (Petrelli punches Monix) -3- (Monix punches Petrelli) 52 -2- (Monix ducks and punches) (cuing the announcers) AND WE'RE ON. THE 'RED LIGHT' GLOWS.
Welcome back to the ABA game of the week... Players hold their heads in pain. Others limp back to the bench.
.The camaraderie and spirit of this league is on full display here tonight... Off camera, Monix delivers a secret punch to Patrelli's spleen.
Jackie runs the half time talk, standing in front of the chalk board.
Okay, solid first half guys, but we're going to have to make some
Monix interrupts Jackie, pissed. He addresses the team, stepping in front of Jackie Moon.

--This is bullshit guys. They're kicking our ass in basketball and they're kicking our ass during the commercials, too. Does anybody here understand the concept of the pick and roll? Because they're going to keep double teaming at the top of the key until somebody rotates the Damn ball...
Yeah! C'mon guys! Rotate the ball. Monix looks at this group and gets even madder. 53.

Does anyone in this room have any pride? Don't you realize, this is thelast four weeks of basketball anyus are ever going to play?Is thishow we're really going togo out?You'd think we'd want toend ourcareers battling, hustling after every loose ball. Boxing out under the boards. Setting picks for our teammates. But we haven't done shit out there. Twiggy Munson and Scootsie Double-Day hang their heads.
We're a bunch of selfish assholes -- And I've got news for you, we aren't going to finish in fourth, we're going to finish dead last. Monix paces in front of the guys, a man possessed.
One day, you're going to look back on your life... And you're going to look back on this time... And you're going to realize... Monix is staring right at Clarence. And Clarence is actua listening...
.You're going to realize you never even played basketball. A moment of silence after the intensity. Monix waddles to door.
Now, you guys have fun out there in the second half. If anyone needs me, I'll be in the training room, draining my knee. Monix limps off, everyone's head is hanging low.
He's right. 54.
Of course he's right. But what the Hell are we supposed to do about it? We don't even have plays.
We're back in Flint. Jackie is back in his office, speaki on the phone.
(into phone) Dukes! I don't make the rules. If they can't cash it, maybe you'll have to go out of state. (BEAT)

I would if I could, but if I give you another check, that would be two checks. That would be $20,000, not ten. What are you trying to pull here? (the other line rings) I've got to take this other call Dukes. Bye!-- (hits a button, answering) Flint Tropics hot line... Oh hey Commish ...

On the floor, instead of a basketball court, the stadium holds an ice-rink. A 'Welcome to the Flint Ice Capades' s is being removed. The entire basketball team is on their hands and knees ASSEMBLING THE HARD WOOD. This is a lot of work. Clarence hits his thumb with a hammer.
Why do we have to put the court together?
I guess the Ice Capades sold out.
Yeah, kids love that stuff. Although, I find the wild-life masks realistic and frightening.
Monix should be here helping us. 55.
Guys. The guys look up to find Jackie. He does not look happy.
The commissioner just called.
What's wrong?
I looks like we've got ourselves a situation. We've got some new 'terms and conditions' for this merger deal.
What'd he say?
Basically, we've got to average at least 2,000 fans per home game for the rest of the year.
2,000 people? Every home game?
He said the NBA will only take a franchise that has fans.
Shit. Winning is going to be hard. But getting 2,000 people to watch is going to be impossible.
Let's try and stay positive. My Mother always believed Flint was a town of destiny. And I believe that. Now, I've already started work on a huge idea to promote us.
What kind of huge idea?
Jackie's place is empty. Monix is drinking alone, totally blasted in the middle of the day. He hangs his head, bare able to order. 56.
Two more Johnny Walkers. And another pack of Kools.
You could use some fresh air, Monix. You want to take a nap in the back of my truck?
(ANGRY)
Just the drinks and the smokes, alright? (BEAT)
Do you have any idea where Lynn is these days?
She asked me to tell you to quit going to her house.
Well, tell her that's just fine with me.
Okay. Sorry man.
Monix. REVEAL: Clarence.
Well, well, well, look who it is. (to the bartender) Brian, I'd like you to meet Jumping Johnny Downtown Funky stuff Boner- time finger-blast Fag-erton.
(to the bartender) Johnny for short. (to Brian, re: Monix) Two coffees.
So, what brings you to the The Kremlin?

Listen, I know you and I haven't always been the best of buddies. 57. But I've been thinking about what you said the other night. This is gonna be our last chance. If I'm ever going to get into the NBA, it's going to be with the Tropics.
I hate to break it to you, Clarence, but the Tropics will never play in the NBA.

So maybe we won't. But like you said, I don't want to look back on this with any regrets. I know what you think of me. But I'm willing to put our differences aside. I'm telling you right now, I'll do whatever it takes to win.
You mean, like, pass?
(with a smile) I would consider passing, yes.
Sorry kid. Even if I wanted to play harder, this knee won't let me.
I'm not just talking about you playing point guard... I'm talking about you teaching us... Monix could not be less interested.
Monix, you know more about basketball than any man who's ever set foot in Flint. Monix drinks, not into it...
All I'm saying is, instead of getting so pissed off at us all the time, why not just show us what the Hell you're talking about? Coach us a little. I mean, we can't get any worse. 58.
And why should I give a shit about the Tropics?
I know you. You've got all that basketball shit stored up in your head. I know you're dying to pass it down to somebody. Why not us?
What about Jackie? He's the coach.
Jackie's got his hands full, trying to sell tickets. He's obsessed. (looking up, re: TV)
ON TV: The Tropics are performing a video not unlike 'The Super Bowl shuffle.' Each member takes a turn rapping, dancing around wooden palm trees with a smile.

(rapping badly) We are the Tropics hooping crew, running and gunning and dunking on you -- But we're not here to talk no trash, we're just here to do the Tropical Mash -- This is the worst video ever made. All the guys boogie ar until Clarence steps forward, taking focus...
(rapping badly) I'm Johnny Johnson and I got the moves -- If you try and stop me, I'll just get smooth --
(rapping badly) My name is Kong and I ain't five feet -- But I get more ass than a toilet seat --
This is my team, so get to know them -- If you get near the lane I'll yank your scrotum -- 59.
-- We are the Tropics hooping crew, running and gunning and dunking too -- We're not here to talk no trash, we're just here to do the Tropical Mash -- The ball girls trot out and boogie with them.
-- They're not here to talk no trash -- they're just here to do the Tropical Mash --
MONIX CAN'T BELIEVE HIS EYES. Either can the bartender. M ignores Clarence.
(to the bartender) Two more Johnny Walkers.
So that's the way it's going to be? Monix doesn't answer, he just drinks. Clarence gets the h and walks out.

Monix looks like shit, laying on the couch, as if he hasn moved for days. Apparently he's been drinking and smoking but not much else. KNOCK KNOCK. Someone's at the door. REVEAL: LYNN lets herself in. Monix is so depressed, he is non-plused.
Looking good Monix.
Thanks. You too.
Ms. Quincy told me the Tropics asked you to coach them. 60
Lynn is draining Monix's knee. It looks painful.
I know what it takes to be a real team, Lynn.
(re: his knee) Stay still. (BEAT)
And that's the reason you won't coach them?
It doesn't matter. The truth is, I hate basketball right now.
Do you really hate basketball? Or do you hate yourself?
Why would I hate myself?
Well, for one, you cheated on me.
You hate me for that. Not me. Lynn just stares at him.
Okay, maybe I hate myself a little.
You don't wear the ring around your neck anymore. (no response) Where is it?
I rode the bench through the playoffs, Lynn.
Monix, that was greatest moment of your career. And you look back on it like some kind of embarrassment. 61.
Riding the bench was the greatest moment of my career?
You did more than ride the bench, Monix.
What else did I do?

Every practice, you took your team to the limit. I know you did. I was the one draining this stupid knee of yours every night. The Celtics were practicing against you, Monix. And when you ran that scout team, you were running Milwaukee's offense better than their first stringers ever could. Lynn continues the business of disposing fluid into the toilet and preparing another syringe.
By game time, your team knew where Milwaukee was going to be before their own players did. The Celtics made the right adjustments to win that series. And those adjustments came from you.
So, I should be proud of running the scout team?
Dave Cowens put that ring in the palm of your hand. And he told you to wear it with pride, because you were a champion. And he meant it too.
He was being a nice guy. The bench is the bench.
Your whole life, you've bitched about people playing selfish. It takes a team to win, right? 62.
That's right.
But when you're on the team, your effort doesn't count? Is that it? (BEAT)
If you weren't on the Celtics that year, would they have won it?
Watch that needle.
Answer me. Would they have won?
I don't know.
Yes you do. You know. Monix looks away for a moment.
Why are you doing this? What does any of this matter, anyway?
What's it matter? You're drinking yourself to death! (BEAT)
God, I wish I hated you as much as you hate yourself! Lynn throws the needle. Monix dodges it.

I made sacrifices! How many years did I support you? And finally, after all of our blood and sweat and bullshit together, you got there, Monix! You made it, you won an NBA championship ring. It wasn't just about you, okay? And I'm sick of you acting like you're some kind of joke. You didn't blow it. You're not a fraud. You're not a fake champion. And all the time we spent together, fighting for you to get to that moment, was not a waste! You're a champion, you asshole! (BEAT)
But if you want to drink yourself to death, go ahead. Fuck you. With that, Lynn is gone. Monix stands alone in the bathro then checks his knee.
It's practice. But this isn't basketball, it's DANCE PRACTICE. The entire team performs a complicated 'intro- dance.'
(CHOREOGRAPHING)
1 and 2 and 3 and 4 and turn like you mean it -- Bee Bee, Arch that back. Yes. Now, the waterfall... One by one, each dips down like a waterfall. And now a le kick.
Nice leg kick Kong. Those flexible hips are a coach's dream. (BEAT)
Now big finish -- and freeze. And then we start the game after that.
Are we going to practice or what?
This is practice, okay Clarence? We need to get two thousand people in here! Our intro dance has to blow people's minds. He begins pacing around, more passionate than ever...

From now on, I want our afros bigger... And shinier ... . I want our shorts shorter... And tighter... We're going to pull our tube socks up higher than we ever have before. The team seems to be looking off screen.
What's wrong? 64. REVEAL: Monix has been watching this whole thing. With Mo on the court, everyone feels kind of stupid.
Hey, you're back! Listen, you should probably chalk your hands up for this number.
Jackie, I asked Monix to coach us.
Coach? Jackie is totally thrown by this. He looks around at the team. Clearly, a decision has been made.
What do you mean, coach? (truly hurt) What is this? What's going on? (staring his team down) It's a Mutiny.
Jackie. Don't be like that.
Hold on a second. Last time I checked, we didn't live in Flint, Russia. We live in Flint, America. I'm coach until a new one is elected.

What.
